channel.title: Gtl Vote Help
channel.description: I've got some annoying problem with the GTLVOTE keep getting a sql error, if someone could skype me "Brodiehenawaylogan" can arrange $$

item.title: Gtl Vote Help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Err. Okay…
So trenta (not a big fan of them, helped a friend who used em) should have a section for you to get your website’s IP address. It’ll be in the control panel of the side (typically…). However, you can always just ping your website.
Open up the start menu, type in ‘cmd’. Right click the cmd program, hit run as admin (This gives us access to features we need).
Now type:
ping www.yourwebsite.com

And when you run that command, it’ll send 3/4 pings to your site. Here’s an example of the text you’ll see from the ping:

Microsoft Windows [Version 6.1.7601] Copyright (c) 2009 Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

C:\Windows\system32>ping www.google.com

Pinging www.google.com [74.125.207.147] with 32 bytes of data:
Reply from 74.125.207.147: bytes=32 time=20ms TTL=47
Reply from 74.125.207.147: bytes=32 time=23ms TTL=47
Reply from 74.125.207.147: bytes=32 time=46ms TTL=47
Reply from 74.125.207.147: bytes=32 time=47ms TTL=47

Ping statistics for 74.125.207.147:
Packets: Sent = 4, Received = 4, Lost = 0 (0% loss),
Approximate round trip times in milli-seconds:
Minimum = 20ms, Maximum = 47ms, Average = 34ms

C:\Windows\system32>

notice how I pinged google, and it got a reply from 74.125.207.147.
www.google.com is a domain, hence what DNS’s are for. Domain Name Servers (DNS) take the domain (such as google) and route it to the IP, so end users like yourself don’t have to. Because it’d be a pain to remember every website by IP address (esp. when sites have multiple servers).

Now that we’ve got your IP, you can replace the ‘localhost’ you put in the server (as your database isn’t local, it’s on whatever server they put your website on).

Read full topic

item.title: Gtl Vote Help
item.dc:creator: @Cryptic317 Cryptic317
item.description:
@Cryptic317 wrote:

Alright then, basically.
im using trentahost as my host for everything and i set my databases
eg.
databases
Name_1234
pass
database_1234

Remte Sql
Local computer IP?
Server IP?
I didnt know which one so i did both

Did that but i used localhost for the database address on the GTL setup at the first Bar
I’ve also got the problem of the vote not going through, you vote and it still says please vote on all links, Cryptic317.com/vote for an example and i dont know what i did wrong there. plus i have this error here

THINGS TO NOTE
I used local host for the database address, trentahost wouldnt tell me if they had a database or not, they keep asking for my password
i used my database,username and password
Moparscape wont accept the vote
i can a “SQL ERROR HAS OCCURED” On server.
this is basically all the info i can give you.

Read full topic

item.title: Gtl Vote Help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Post the error, it will help us help you… (See the link in my signature)

Also, we do not allow cash rewards, payments, donations, etc… All help here is free (see the rules).

We’d like to help you over the forums instead of via skype, that way if someone else has a similar issue. They can get this thread as a result in a search and solve their issue based on how you solved yours.
